thread.title_full: Thais Enjoy 14-day Visa-Free Air Travel To Myanmar From todayTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Thais Enjoy 14-day Visa-Free Air Travel To Myanmar From todayTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Thais Enjoy 14-day Visa-Free Air Travel To Myanmar From today
Thai people will enjoy their 14-day visa-free air travels to Myanmar as of Tuesday, Thai News Agency (TNA) reported.
The Thai Ministry of Foreign Affairs confirmed the new Myanmar policy on Monday.
Thai Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister General Tanasak Patimaprakorn said that the new 14-day visa-waiver policy enabled Thai citizens to enter Myanmar through three international airports and allowed to stay in the neighbouring country up to 14 days.
The airports are Nay Pyi Taw, Yangon and Mantalay International Airports.
As for the policy on issuing multiple-entry visa for international tourists who frequently travel in and out of Thailand, General Tanasak said that the Thai Ministry of Interior has issued a ministerial regulation that the authorities concerned must always take national security into account before approving the multiple-entry visa to any international visitor.
